dt: {bc}a thought or idea based on scanty evidence {bc}{sx|conjecture||}

et: Middle English, allegation, charge, from Anglo-French, from feminine of {it}surmis{/it}, past participle of {it}surmettre{/it} to place on, suppose, accuse, from Medieval Latin {it}supermittere{/it}, from Late Latin, to place on, from Latin {it}super- + mittere{/it} to let go, send
shortdef: a thought or idea based on scanty evidence : conjecture

dt: {bc}to form a notion of from scanty evidence {bc}{sx|imagine||}, {sx|infer||}

et: Middle English, to allege, from {it}surmise{/it}, noun
shortdef: to form a notion of from scanty evidence : imagine, infer
